Eta orain dela bi urte izan behar zena, gutxienez, ea posible den bi urte beranduago. Uste dugu inflexio-puntua izan behar dela EITBn, herri honek behar duen hedabide publiko baten inguruko eztabaida eta adostasunak lortze aldera behingoz, kanpo-proiekzioan zein barne-kudeaketan.

Zuzendari berria izendatu beharko da. Eta espero dugu Maite Iturberen izendapenaren harira 2013an izandako eztabaida gainditzea. Esan genuen: 27 eta 16, 43 dira, nahikoa da zuzendari bat izendatzeko; aldiz, ez da inondik inora nahikoa EITBk momentu honetan herritarren aldetik galdua duen atxikimendua lortzeko. Eta denborak arrazoia eman digu.

Orduan, eskaera bat. Eskaera bat mentalitate horrekin ari zareten guztioi: ez itzazue beste behin zuen bozak horretarako baliatu, ez dugu Telemadrid bat nahi. Espero dugu alderdi batzuen arteko akordio sekretu batean ez geratzea, EITBz gutxi edo ezer ez duen akordio batean. Postuak tarteko, alderdi-interesak gailentzen diren beste akordio batekin ez dugu topo egin nahi, ezinbestekoa den eztabaidari atea itxiko dion beste PNV-PSE akordio batekin ez dugu topo egin nahi.

Lehentasunez, erronkez eta EITBren ereduaz hitz egin nahi dugu. Eman aukera hori, guztion artean horretaz hitz egiteko. Eta horren arabera akordioak eta adostasunak baldin badaude, prest egongo da aurrerantzean ere hartu beharreko ardura eta konpromiso guztiak hartzeko.

Eskerrik asko.

text_en:
Okay. Ladies and gentlemen. Again we see in this Parliament nostalgic of the Second Republic. Note, moreover, that none of us here have lived it.

And they have resold it to us as the panacea of freedom and democracy, within that propaganda work to whitewash a sectarian and libertarian regime that led Spain to a civil war.

Moreover, the left, or rather the ultra-left, sells it to us as an authentic democracy, ensuring that the present monarchy is not. We believe that the concept of democracy that you, Leninists, handle remains very evident if we look at examples such as Venezuela, Cuba, China or North Korea.

But I will list some of the rights and freedoms that we enjoy today and which you have not alluded to, which, moreover, have been brutally abused in the Second Republic.

Freedom to criticize any State institution. We've got her today. That's why you criticize the monarchy. There wasn't one in the Second Republic.

Freedom of information. Today there is no censorship. In the Second Republic there was.

Freedom of religion. Thank God, we also enjoy it today. In the Second Republic there was only killing against the religious.

Freedom of education. We're enjoying it today. Neither was there in the Second Republic. Parents could not freely choose how to educate their children.

And finally, freedom to wave the red flag. In the Second Republic this flag and the defense of the monarchy were prohibited.

Gentlemen of Podemos, they speak of freedom and democracy, when what they mean is that they want to take away these freedoms from us.

Mr. Alonso, I wasn't going to come in with you, but I'm going to answer you. rejects all kinds of violence. But it does it with the big mouth, not with the little and slippery mouth, as you do. We condemn all the violence, including that of Sestao, Vallecas and Barcelona, which we not only condemn...

...but we have suffered it.

doesn't differentiate between violence, as you do. Do you know how they did it? Signing an infamous document presented by those who instigate such violence, the Lords of Podemos.
text:
Bueno. Señorías. Nuevamente vemos en este Parlamento nostálgicos de la Segunda República. Obsérvese, además, que ninguno de los aquí presentes la hemos vivido.

Y han vuelto a vendérnosla como la panacea de la libertad y la democracia, dentro de esa labor de propaganda para blanquear a un régimen sectario y liberticida que condujo a España a una guerra civil.

Además, la izquierda, o llámese ultraizquierda más bien, nos la vende como una auténtica democracia, asegurando que la monarquía actual no lo es. Creemos que el concepto de democracia que manejan ustedes, señores leninistas, queda muy en evidencia si nos asomamos a ejemplos como Venezuela, Cuba, China o Corea del Norte.

Pero les voy a enumerar algunos derechos y libertades que hoy disfrutamos y a los que ustedes no han hecho alusión, que, además, tuvieron un maltrato brutal en la Segunda República.

Libertad para criticar a cualquier institución del Estado. Hoy la tenemos. Por eso ustedes critican a la monarquía. En la Segunda República no la había.

Libertad de información. Hoy en día no existe censura. En la Segunda República sí la había.

Libertad de religión. Gracias a Dios, también la disfrutamos hoy. En la Segunda República solo había matanza contra los religiosos.

Libertad de educación. Gozamos de ella hoy. En la Segunda República tampoco la había. Los padres no podían elegir libremente cómo educar a sus hijos.

Y, por último, libertad para ondear la bandera rojigualda. En la Segunda República esta bandera y la defensa de la monarquía estaban prohibidas.

Señores de Podemos, hablan de libertad y democracia, cuando lo que quieren decir es que nos quieren quitar estas libertades.

Señor Alonso, no iba a entrar con usted, pero le voy a responder. rechaza todo tipo de violencia. Pero lo hace con la boca grande, no con la pequeña y de soslayo, como hacen ustedes. Condenamos todas las violencias, incluso la de Sestao, Vallecas y Barcelona, que no solo la condenamos…

… sino que la hemos sufrido.

no diferencia entre violencias, como hacen ustedes. ¿Saben cómo lo han hecho? Firmando un infame documento presentado por quienes instigan ese tipo de violencia, los señores de Podemos.

Yeah. Well, thanks again.

Well, we didn't sign it, and in order to make it clear, because our corrections were ignored, but at all events we don't have the deal signed in contempt, because it seems interesting to us: It's a step forward, but a little bit.

And that the occasion of the ojal is right, by what Erasez de Egilaz said, that a new road is opened, but precedents are not at all good: What was signed on the budget agreement in 2019 wasn't done, some of the things he planned to do haven't been completed. Ojalá, as the chief physician of the Arrians says a great deal.

And, in conclusion, this subject is very much discussed, because the steps and the tests are very slow, because they take very little steps, and I declare that in February we shall now present another as well as the state of the researchers, not at home, but about the state of the researchers. We all, I repeat, praise the enquiry, and the inquiry into this society, but this investigation must be made on good conditions, and not only on wages.

Eta hori. Eskerrik asko.

text_en:
Thank you, Mr. President. Ladies and gentlemen, good morning to all. Good morning, President.

It has been 18 months since the general elections, in which the role of his party and the performance of his Government have been key to keeping President Sánchez in Moncloa, where the PNV put him three years ago.

Thanks to you, the Spaniards have the worst government in one of the worst moments of our history, because you tell us, you sell us that this of the Frankenstein governments is good for the Basques.

His Government's relationship with Mr Sánchez also seems to be in keeping with that logic, but we all know that when Spain goes badly to the Basques, we are worse off, even if the PNV goes well or is sometimes satisfied.

The facts deny so much idyllic, Mr Sánchez's calamity of management adds to that of our domestic miscarriages. This same week let us think about Azpeitia, Corrugated, the whereabouts of the star project around hydrogen, Euskaltel, Tubacex, Petronor, etc., and that the breaches of its partner, the defrauded expectations affect key elements for our recovery on our land and for overcoming the crisis.

That is why I ask you, lehendakari: How do you appreciate the relationship with Mr Sánchez and the successive non-compliances despite the expectations created?

By his answers, lehendakari, I see him moderately satisfied, as he does not want to get into the issue despite the loss of wealth, the flight of investments from this oasis – in quotes – Basque that we have. Much more satisfied than our hoteliers, for example, who are desperate with Labi delays and expect them to pay attention to what we have requested by extending schedules and that there are more diners per table.

But I don't understand your comments about the relationship you may have with President Sánchez, whom you will see from time to time, because we only receive desaires, desaires. Yeah, you take pictures of him.

If we talk about the health and management of the pandemic, as we saw two weeks ago, no political towards you. There they are made up of the autonomous communities, including Euskadi, after the end of the state of alarm. And it won't be because you didn't do public rogatives and epistolaries, you'll remember.

If we talk about employment and efforts for family recovery, there is the bargain around minimum living income. Mrs Mendia herself has put the adjectives to Mr Sánchez's Government's proposal, little less than a management order without material or human means.

If we talk about the future, about reactivation, about European funds, you know, more of the same, castles in the air. The months go by without news and without realising anything.

And if we're talking about investments, infrastructure, that's where we have the high-speed train hairpin. Less heart and more head, lehendakari. Dates, concrete commitments. In 2018, you will remember, Mr Rajoy's commitment, the People's Party government, was 2023; today we go for the year 2026 and adding. One year late for every year of Mr. Sánchez's government. A real record.

Nice business I'd tell him we made the Basques with the PNV bet for the Frankenstein governments. Non-compliance in non-compliance.

His partner, Mr Sánchez, is a ballast for the whole of Spain and for the Basques. A burden on Spain's economic recovery, political stability or international projection. And when all that is wrong in Spain, I have told you before and I repeat it again, we too in the Basque Country are wrong.

It is your responsibility, your Government, your party, that Mr Sánchez be where he is.

I remind you that this ballast is also capable of dragging you, that you will not be able to avoid the consequences of an complicity in which you receive desaire after desaire.

Therefore, if you were the creators of Mr Sánchez's coming into power, perhaps you should go and contribute to the end of a regrettable cycle. The interest of the Basques is to put an end to Mr Sánchez's cycle of misappointments and desairs in Moncloa.
text:
Eskerrik asko, legebiltzarburu andrea. Jaun-andreok, egun on denoi. Egun on, lehendakari.

Han pasado 18 meses ya desde las elecciones generales, en los que el papel de su partido y la actuación de su Gobierno han sido claves para mantener al presidente Sánchez en la Moncloa, donde el PNV le puso hace ya tres años.

Gracias a ustedes, los españoles contamos con el peor Gobierno en uno de los peores momentos de nuestra historia, porque ustedes nos cuentan, nos venden que esto de los “gobiernos Frankenstein” nos va bien a los vascos.

La relación de su Gobierno con el señor Sánchez también parece obedecer a esa lógica, pero todos sabemos que cuando a España le va mal a los vascos nos va peor, aunque al PNV le vaya bien o se dé por satisfecho a veces.

Los hechos desmienten tanto idilio, la calamidad de gestión del señor Sánchez se suma a la de nuestros desatinos domésticos. Esta misma semana pensemos en Azpeitia, Corrugados, en el paradero del proyecto estrella en torno al hidrógeno, Euskaltel, Tubacex, Petronor, etcétera, y que los incumplimientos de su socio, las expectativas defraudadas afectan a elementos clave para nuestra recuperación en nuestra tierra y para la superación de la crisis.

Por eso, yo le pregunto, lehendakari: ¿Cómo valora la relación con el señor Sánchez y los sucesivos incumplimientos pese a las expectativas creadas?

Por sus respuestas, lehendakari, le veo moderadamente satisfecho, ya que no quiere entrar en el tema a pesar de la pérdida de riqueza, de la fuga de inversiones de este oasis –entre comillas– vasco que tenemos. Mucho más satisfecho que nuestros hosteleros, por ejemplo, que se desesperan con retrasos del Labi y esperan que hagan caso de lo que nosotros hemos pedido ampliando horarios y que haya más comensales por mesa.

Pero no entiendo comentarios suyos con respecto a la relación que pueda tener con el presidente Sánchez, al cual usted va a ver de vez en cuando, porque solo recibimos desaires, desaires. Sí, se hace fotografías con él.

Si hablamos de la sanidad y de la gestión de la pandemia, como ya vimos hace dos semanas, ninguneo político hacia usted. Allá se las compongan las comunidades autónomas, incluida Euskadi, tras el fin del estado de alarma. Y no será porque no hiciera usted rogativas públicas y epistolares, se acordará.

Si hablamos de empleo y esfuerzos para la recuperación de las familias, ahí está el regateo en torno al ingreso mínimo vital. La propia señora Mendia ha puesto los adjetivos a la propuesta del Gobierno del señor Sánchez, para poco menos que una encomienda de gestión sin medios materiales o humanos.

Si hablamos de futuro, de reactivación, de fondos europeos, ya lo saben, más de lo mismo, castillos en el aire. Pasan los meses sin noticias y sin concretar nada.

Y si hablamos de inversiones, de infraestructuras, ahí tenemos la tomadura de pelo del tren de alta velocidad. Menos corazón y más cabeza, lehendakari. Fechas, compromisos concretos. En 2018, lo recordará, el compromiso del señor Rajoy, Gobierno del Partido Popular, era 2023; hoy vamos por el año 2026 y sumando. Un año de retraso por cada año de Gobierno del señor Sánchez. Un verdadero récord.

Bonito negocio yo le diría que hemos hecho los vascos con la apuesta del PNV por los “gobiernos Frankenstein”. De incumplimiento en incumplimiento.

Su socio, el señor Sánchez, es un lastre para el conjunto de España y para los vascos. Un lastre para la recuperación económica, la estabilidad política o la proyección internacional de España. Y cuando todo eso va mal en España, se lo he dicho antes y lo vuelvo a repetir, a nosotros también en el País Vasco nos va mal.

Es responsabilidad suya, de su Gobierno, de su partido, que el señor Sánchez esté donde está.

Le recuerdo que ese lastre también es capaz de arrastrarles a ustedes, que no van a poder evitar las consecuencias de una complicidad en la que reciben desaire tras desaire.

Por eso, si fueron ustedes artífices de la llegada al poder del señor Sánchez, quizá deban irse planteando contribuir al fin de un ciclo lamentable. El interés de los vascos pasa por poner fin al ciclo de desatinos y desaires del señor Sánchez en la Moncloa.

text_en:
Yes, ma'am, all the members of the legislature, good morning.

I think today it is necessary to start with a few verses of Quevedo: "Powerful gentleman is Don Dinero. He is born in the honorable Indies, where the world accompanies him; he comes to die in Spain, and he is buried in Genoa."

Quevedo knew the corruption of ministers, judges, and bankers, and very little altered. 'At the school of vice,' the students prepared for the next time: "bachiller's mentir, licciaura engañar, doctorado en robar y caedrico en medrair." The seeds of corruption.

What's corruption? I shall use Paolo Maur's definition for corruption: to employ a public officer in such a manner as is not permitted by his condition, in exchange for private money or benefits.

We were on the radio the other day, all of a sudden, and I remember some of us mentioned that the Popular Party was the worst part of Europe. And I remember Mr. Damborena was there and asked: "Refused? What kind of something? What's the worst part of it? "I don't know.

I thought the question was very interesting, but the answer was even more interesting. What, on the side of the case? Well, in the 2013 American Council of the Judicial Power, the cases of corruption opened in the different functions of the Spanish sentence were 1.661 with 500 inputs, though only 20 persons in prison.

Recent data: Between the 1st of July, 2016th of July, the 30th of September, the various Spanish judgments were divided, or the verbal trial was opened to the political manager, 1.338 in cases of corruption. I can't give more updated data, they're the last ones.

All these cases are not of the Popular Party, but most of them belong to the rene, so that if we look at the cases and litigants, we shall be victorious in Europe.

But we will continue with the question proposed by Monsieur Damboea: In Europe, is the popular party the most corrupt of all the money they have given or received? Well, the Spanish trade and contest Commission (la Commision Nacional de los Mercados y de la Commetencia) has counted the annual cost of corruption at 90.000 euros; more than half, over the administrative system.

Let us look at the most familiar cases: It's from PSOE, but it's counted in 1.200 million euros-the Malaya case, 2400 million euros, commissions, and change suits.

We can go on, but is it worth it? Or is the most corrupt party in people's perceptions?

When people were asked who was the first, the greatest problems in the second and third Spain, "Sullery and fraud," 54%,3 answered, 12% of April. It's true, when the question was asked, that Lezo was in the middle of the line, arrested by Ignacio Gonzále, and the Attorney General, against Manuel Moix, proposed not to do one of them.

But the worst is impunity. Because Mr Moix has ceased to be a chief anti-corruption prosecutor, not precisely because he has ceased, but will continue in the Supreme Court's career, surely to continue to be that prosecutor more concerned with hindering corruption investigations than pushing them forward.

Of course, this could be a point where we can only talk about the People's Party. We could go on the local: here we have the San Antonio premises... But when we tried to have a joint motion, it was not possible, because the groups of the Basque Nationalist Party and the Socialist Party did not want to reproach the structural nature of corruption. They chose more to show their concern. If we share the concern! The point is that that concern leads us to reproach him.

But they also proposed to eliminate that of the permissive attitude which with it holds different powers of the State. And this is where there is no possibility of agreement, because denying reality is to encourage and facilitate corruption to continue, and remain structural, and not because I say so.

Of course, in the second half of the 1980s the scandals of irregular financing of political parties began, and that was a novelty, because until then corruption had been more of a particular type, rather than at the level of organizations. The academic analysis on corruption in Spain points out – and I read textually – that "personal enrichments were replaced by a trend towards systematic irregular practice by political entities that constantly increased their funding needs, the same actors that generated the illegal acts of the parties their main beneficiaries".

The names we know have basically been characters who allegedly acted as brokers between corrupting entities and the organization. The secretaries of the Naseiro or Bárcenas People's Party are an example, or Juan Guerra in the case of the PSOE.

I also remember the phrase of Professor Justo Serna when he speaks of the Spanish political class: he says that exercising power has meant greed and domination.

In addition to the deterioration of the image of the parties when they all come out in defense of the corrupt. Because another issue is pardons. These criminals have been pardoned: from 1996 to 2014 409 were pardoned for corruption. This is a permissive attitude.

A detail that is no less: the main scandals of corruption have been uncovered by chivatazos, and not by the control agencies. Another proof of the system's permissiveness.

The regulation of political financing in Spain, including the 2007 and 2012 reforms, remains remarkably flawed. In fact, also in academic analysis – we read in texts by García Viñuela or González de Aguilar – they point out, and I read textually: "They are designed to hinder the knowledge of the activities that the parties intend to keep hidden".

Because, with regard to the transparency of party revenue and expenditure, the accounts they submit to the Court of Auditors do not go through a prior professional audit check, nor do they integrate all the organizations that make up the party. Donations... must be reported, yes, but in the 2012 reform legislators conveniently forgot to specify what would happen in case of non-compliance. By the way, let us also not forget that the Court of Auditors cannot investigate companies that collaborate with the parties, nor can it punish them for failing to comply with their legal obligation to cooperate with them.

In this context, of course, it is not surprising that the Greek (the Group of States against Corruption) does not appear in his reports to be very consistent with Spanish anti-corruption behaviour, and complains (with ad hoc diplomatic circumloquies), rather than of the existence or better or worse criminal and procedural regulations, of the lack of effectiveness of the persecution. Because the persistence of corruption, as in other criminal phenomena, is not necessarily due to the lack of legislation in this regard, but to its lack of implementation. And in this respect the Greek reports are demolishing.

Also the most well-known indicators (the Corruption Perceptions Index of International Transparency, the World Bank's Control of Corruption, or the International Country Risk Guide) often produce very similar results and trends.

As cases continue to emerge, Spain has suffered one of the most pronounced falls in recent years in the indices. In the last one, Spain has fallen seven points since 2012, and with a score of 58 it is one of the worst ranked countries among Western European democracies. In November 2016, 80% of people felt that the government was not acting in the face of corruption. No other country in the European Union reaches these levels. In that, of course, Spain wins by score.

The Council of Europe also rejected the politicization of the system to elect the judiciary. In 2013, when the Group of States against Corruption made eleven recommendations to Spain to better combat corruption among parliamentarians, judges and prosecutors, the institution expressed alarm that the country's political corruption scandals were so great that they imposed duties to try to resolve the situation. However, the results of the 2016 evaluation considered that none of the eleven measures proposed at the time had received a satisfactory response; in fact, six of them had not even been implemented.

Pardons, lack of investigation, lack of interest in implementing recommendations... That is why we are talking about the permissive attitude of different powers of the State.

The Spanish state is at 48. It has above all countries such as Brunei, Lithuania, Cape Verde, Saint Lucia, Botswana, Taiwan, Slovenia, Qatar, Barbados, Portugal, Bhutan... This is what the systematic corruption of the parties is achieving.

We have the case War, the case Filesa, Roldán, Mario Conde, case Naseiro, case Gürtel, the papers of Bárcenas, the case Palau, the case Pujol, all the cases of the municipalities after the liberation of the soil, the systematic balls, the AVE, the airports, the case Saqueo, the case Malaya, all the cases of the Spanish royal family, the papers of Panama, the false ERE, the operation Punica, the black cards, the rotating doors... Of course, from Mariano Rajoy to the last councillor of Urbanism are involved.

And I want to end up with another sentence, too. Esopo said years ago: "We hang little thieves, but we choose great thieves for public offices." It is time to end it without excuse, without justification, for corruption is the cancer of this society.

Thank you.
text:
Mahaiburu andrea, legebiltzarkide guztiak, egun on.

Creo que hoy es menester empezar con unos versos de Quevedo: "Poderoso caballero es don Dinero. Nace en las Indias honrado, donde el mundo le acompaña; viene a morir en España, y es en Génova enterrado".

Ondo ezagutzen zuen Quevedok ministroen, epaileen eta bankarien ustelkeria, eta oso gutxi aldatu da. "Bizioen eskolan" ikasleak prestatzen ziren hurrengorako: "bachiller en mentir, licenciatura en engañar, doctorado en robar y catedrático en medrar". Ustelkeriaren haziak, hain zuzen ere.

Ustelkeria zer da? Nik Paolo Mauroren definizioa erabiliko dut ustelkeriarako: kargudun publiko bat bere egoeraz zilegi ez den moduan baliatzea diru edo onura pribatuen truke.

Lehengo batean egon ginen irratian, debatean, eta gogoratzen dut batzuek aipatu egin genuela Europako alderdirik ustelena zela. Eta gogoratzen dut Damborenea jauna hor zegoela eta galdera bat egin zuela: "Ustelena? Ustelena, zertan? Zertan da ustelena?".

Niri galdera oso interesgarria iruditu zitzaidan, baina are interesgarriagoa erantzuna. Ustelena kasuen aldetik? Beno, Botere Judizialaren Kontseilu Nagusiaren 2013ko informean agertzen da urte horretan Espainiako epai-organo ezberdinetan irekitako ustelkeria-kasuak 1.661 zirela, 500 inputaturekin, nahiz eta kartzelan soilik 20 pertsona inguru izan.

Azken datuak: 2015eko uztailaren 1etik 2016ko irailaren 30era tartean Espainiako epai-organo ezberdinetan prozesatu edo ahozko epaiketa ireki zitzaien 1.338 arduradun politikori, guztira 160 ustelkeria-kasutan. Ezin dut datu eguneratuagorik eman, horiek dira azkenak.

Kasu hauek guztiak ez dira Partido Popularrarenak, baina renak dira gehienak; beraz, kasu eta inputatuei erreparatzen badiegu, bai, , Europan irabazle.

Baina Damborenea jaunak planteatutako zalantzarekin jarraituko dugu: Europan, al da, baita ere, emandako edo jasotako diru-kopuruari begira ere ustelena? Beno, Espainiako Merkatu eta Lehiaren Komisioak (la Comisión Nacional de los Mercados y de la Competencia) ustelkeriaren urteko kostua 90.000 milioi eurotan zenbatu du; erdia baino gehiago, gainkostu administratiboetan.

Begira diezaiegun, orduan, kasu ezagunenei: EREren kasua, hau PSOErena da, bai, baina 1.200 milioi eurotan zenbatu dute; Malayaren kasua, 2.400 milioi eurotan, komisioetan eta diru-zuriketetan.

Jarrai dezakegu, baina merezi al du? Edo da ustelena jendearen pertzepzioetan?

CISek argitaratu berri duen maiatzeko azken barometroan, jendeari galdetzen zitzaionean zein zen lehengo, bigarren eta hirugarren Espainiako arazorik handienak "Ustelkeria eta iruzurra" % 54,3k erantzun dute, apirilean baino % 12 gehiago. Egia da, galdera egin zenean, justu, Lezo operazioa pil-pilean zegoela, Ignacio González atxilotuta eta Manuel Moix Ustelkeriaren kontrako fiskal buruak miaketetako bat ez egitea proposatu zuela.

Pero lo peor es la impunidad. Porque el señor Moix ha dejado de ser fiscal jefe anticorrupción, no precisamente porque se le haya cesado, pero va a seguir en la carrera del Tribunal Supremo, seguramente para seguir siendo ese fiscal más preocupado en entorpecer investigaciones de corrupción que en impulsarlas.

Desde luego, podría ser este un punto en el que solo hablemos del Partido Popular. Podríamos seguir por lo local: aquí tenemos los locales de San Antonio… Pero cuando hemos intentado transar una moción conjunta no ha sido posible, porque los grupos del Partido Nacionalista Vasco y el Partido Socialista no querían reprobar el carácter estructural de la corrupción. Optaban más por mostrar su preocupación. ¡Si compartimos la preocupación! La cuestión es que esa preocupación nos lleva a reprobarlo.

Pero además proponían eliminar lo de la actitud permisiva que con ella mantienen distintos poderes del Estado. Y aquí es donde no hay posibilidad de acuerdo, porque negar la realidad es fomentar y facilitar que la corrupción siga, y siga siendo estructural, y no porque lo diga yo.

Desde luego, en la segunda mitad de los ochenta comenzaron los escándalos de financiación irregular de los partidos políticos, y esa era una novedad, porque hasta ese momento la corrupción había sido más de tipo particular, más que a nivel de organizaciones. El análisis académico que se hace sobre la corrupción en España señala –y leo textualmente– que "se sustituyeron los enriquecimientos personales por una tendencia a la práctica irregular sistemática por parte de unas entidades políticas que aumentaban incesantemente sus necesidades de financiación, siendo los mismos actores que generaban los actos ilícitos de los partidos sus principales beneficiarios".

Los nombres que conocemos han sido básicamente personajes que actuaban presuntamente como intermediarios ente corruptores y la organización. Los secretarios del Partido Popular Naseiro o Bárcenas son un ejemplo, o Juan Guerra en el caso del PSOE.

Recuerdo también la frase del catedrático Justo Serna cuando habla de la clase política española: dice que ejercer el poder ha significado avaricia y dominación.

Además del deterioro de la imagen de los partidos cuando todos a una salen en defensa del corrupto. Porque otra de las cuestiones son los indultos. Estos delincuentes han sido indultados: desde 1996 hasta 2014 se indultó a 409 condenados por corrupción. Esto es actitud permisiva.

Un detalle también que no es menor: los principales escándalos de corrupción han sido destapados por chivatazos, y no por los organismos de control. Otra prueba de la permisividad del sistema.

La regulación de la financiación política en España, incluyendo las reformas de 2007 y 2012, sigue siendo notablemente defectuosa. De hecho, también en análisis académicos –leemos en textos de García Viñuela o de González de Aguilar– señalan, y leo textualmente: "Están pensados para obstaculizar el conocimiento de las actividades que los partidos pretenden mantener ocultas".

Porque, respecto a la transparencia de ingresos y gastos de los partidos, las contabilidades que estos presentan al Tribunal de Cuentas no pasan por un control previo de auditoría profesional, ni tampoco integran todas las organizaciones que componen el partido. Las donaciones…, se debe informar de las mismas, eso sí, pero en la reforma de 2012 los legisladores convenientemente olvidaron precisar qué ocurriría en caso de incumplimiento. Por cierto, tampoco olvidemos que el Tribunal de Cuentas no puede investigar a las empresas que colaboran con los partidos, ni puede sancionarlas por incumplir su obligación legal de colaborar con él.

En este contexto, desde luego que no es de extrañar que el Greco (el Grupo de Estados Contra la Corrupción) no se muestre en sus informes muy conforme con el comportamiento anticorruptivo español, y se queja (con los circunloquios diplomáticos ad hoc ), más que de la existencia o de una mejor o peor normativa penal y procesal, de la poca eficacia de la persecución. Porque la persistencia de la corrupción, igual que en los demás fenómenos delictivos, no se debe necesariamente a la falta de legislación al respecto, sino a su falta de aplicación. Y en este aspecto los informes del Greco son demoledores.

También los indicadores más conocidos (el Corruption Perceptions Index de Transparencia Internacional, el Control of Corruption del Banco Mundial, o la International Country Risk Guide) suelen arrojar unos resultados y unas tendencias muy similares.

A medida que siguen saliendo casos, España ha sufrido una de las caídas más pronunciadas en los últimos años en los índices. En el último, España ha caído siete puntos desde 2012, y con una nota de 58 es uno de los países peor clasificados entre las democracias de Europa occidental. En noviembre de 2016, el 80 % de la gente opinaba que el Gobierno no actuaba ante la corrupción. Ningún otro país de la Unión Europea alcanza esos niveles. En eso, desde luego, España gana por goleada.

El Consejo de Europa reprobó también la politización del sistema para elegir al Poder Judicial. En 2013, cuando el Grupo de Estados contra la Corrupción planteó a España once recomendaciones para combatir mejor la corrupción entre los parlamentarios, los jueces y los fiscales, la institución manifiesta alarmada que los escándalos de corrupción política del país eran tan grandes que imponían unos deberes para intentar resolver la situación. Sin embargo, los resultados de la evaluación de 2016 consideran que ninguna de las once medidas propuestas entonces ha obtenido una respuesta satisfactoria; de hecho, seis de ellas ni siquiera se han puesto en marcha.

Indultos, falta de investigación, falta de interés en poner en marcha las recomendaciones… Por todo eso hablamos de actitud permisiva de distintos poderes del Estado.

El Estado español está en la 48. Tiene por encima países como Brunéi, Lituania, Cabo Verde, Santa Lucía, Botsuana, Taiwán, Eslovenia, Qatar, Barbados, Portugal, Bután… Esto es lo que está consiguiendo la corrupción sistemática de los partidos.

Tenemos el caso Guerra, el caso Filesa, Roldán, Mario Conde, caso Naseiro, caso Gürtel, los papeles de Bárcenas, el caso Palau, el caso Pujol, todos los casos de los ayuntamientos tras la liberación del suelo, los pelotazos sistemáticos, el AVE, los aeropuertos, el caso Saqueo, el caso Malaya, todos los casos de la familia real española, los papeles de Panamá, los falsos ERE, la operación Púnica, las tarjetas black , las puertas giratorias… Desde luego, desde Mariano Rajoy hasta el último concejal de Urbanismo están involucrados.

Eta beste esaldi batekin bukatu nahi dut nik ere. Esopok orain dela urte asko zioen: "Lapur txikiak urkatzen ditugu, baina lapur handiak aukeratu egiten ditugu kargu publikoetarako". Bada garaia horrekin amaitzeko, aitzakiarik gabe, justifikaziorik gabe, ustelkeria gizarte honen minbizia baita.

Eskerrik asko.

text_en:
Thank you, Madam President. Counselor, ladies and gentlemen.

Mrs López de Ocariz, you lately have a tendency to get entangled in the name of things and not to talk about things themselves. He did so two weeks ago about the Euskadi Trade Distribution Observatory, and he does so again today about the Euskadi Tourism Observatory.

I'll tell him. The Euskadi Tourist Observatory is an initiative of CIC Tourgune, which you at least mention in the written question but has previously left aside. The CIC Tourgune is created in February 2007, as are others such as the Nanogune or Biogune, with the aim of generating knowledge about tourism. Almost at the same time, Basquetour is created as a Basque Tourist Agency, for promotion and, let's say, to analyze and promote competitiveness in the tourist services of Euskadi, in what seemed to be an intelligent strategy as tourism took off in Euskadi, with two tools that allowed to give support from public management: to give support on the one hand in the actions to promote and improve the competitiveness of tourism in Euskadi, and on the other in the generation of knowledge about tourism.

In 2010 the CIC Tourgune proposes a collaboration with Basquetour for the creation of a tourist observatory in Euskadi; a proposal that I know, a serious proposal, a proposal with content, a proposal that is current and well attached to the field at the time it is formulated, and a proposal that is also ambitious: it talked about competitive intelligence, it talked about open innovation and it talked about collective intelligence. And it also started from the analysis of other observatories in Spain and the world.

And it was an ambitious proposal that raised three areas of improvement and that also raised an ambitious structure. The areas of improvement were a harmonisation of sources (the small guirigay that exists around the indicators in relation to tourism); two, a visualization and the possibility of allowing dynamic analysis of information, and, third, the inclusion of sources of digital information, which has come to be called big data. And the areas in which it organized that structure of the Basque Tourist Observatory to which you refer were: a statistical area, a tourism area – the one referring to that digital information –, an area of studies and research, and an area of documentation.

In 2012, the result of this collaborative approach to the creation of the observatory, an expert position in social research was created in Basquetour, precisely to serve as a link with the needs that Basquetour may pose with the development of research and technological development around this research that is being carried out by CIC Tourgune.

The CIC Tourgune not only poses this expert liaison position, but is beginning to develop its system. It develops a regional system of tourist indicators (the SRIT), develops a hotel price monitor, develops a destination website monitor, and initiates the design of several tools around the creation of this Euskadi tourist observatory. That is not, as you have said, a Basquetour tourist observatory, but a Basquetour tourist observatory that develops CIC Tourgune in collaboration with Basquetour.

But what happens in 2015? For in 2015 there is a review of the CICs (the cooperative research centers), and one of the ones that closes is this, CIC Tourgune. Therefore, if you close CIC Tourgune and the Euskadi Tourist Observatory is at CIC Tourgune, the Euskadi Tourist Observatory you refer to in your inquiry is no longer there. What remains is, as it were, a pale reflection of the original project of the Basque Tourist Observatory proposed by the CIC Tourgune.

What's left of the CIC Tourgune? There's a part of your... Note that this was the complete development of the observatory.

Do you know what's left? There is one part, this small part, which is the automatic load of information from statistical sources. It is a small part not only because it refers only to some indicators, but also because it does not include sources of origin data that included the original SRIT.

But, given the department's interest in maintaining at that time – once CIC Tourgune closes – for maintaining a database that was being built by CIC Tourgune, a database around a series of indicators, even if it was more limited than the original model, what is done is to transport the tool built by CIC Tourgune and contract the maintenance of information about that tool.

And that's what, with the 2015 closure of CIC Tourgune, has actually done Tecnalia in 2016 and 2017. And it is called the Euskadi Tourist Observatory, but obviously it has nothing to do with this Euskadi Tourist Observatory. Moreover, there is another Euskadi Tourist Observatory, which is referred to by one of the pages you have taught here.

The expert person responsible for research who served as a liaison with CIC Tourgune in Basquetour also organizes within Basquetour an area called the Euskadi Tourist Observatory. The two things are different things, but the two get the same name, and neither of the two things is really the ambitious project, and, from my point of view, intelligent and well-conceived of origin, of the CIC Tourgune in 2010.

That's what we have, and that's what's left. In addition, there is the one we do from the department on time every time we give information on the statistical data, but the collection, which you said was so interesting, for the maintenance of that observatory, was actually a small part that only included information from the Eustat, the INE, the AENA and the Ports of the State.

Of course, the department and I are betting on keeping the intelligence of the market. It is absolutely necessary, in today's environment – not only in tourism, but also of course in tourism – to keep information about the environment, because otherwise, public management simply becomes a kind of blind stick without knowing what environment one moves in.

Market intelligence is maintained. We maintain official statistical operations (I told him the other day that this was what justified the creation of the department's statistical body); Ibiltur, Familitur, Frontur, those operations are maintained, and we also include many other studies.

But the observatory as such, which does not have to do with what we call today's observatory with the original concept of the Basque Tourist Observatory, does not in fact respond to the demands that can be made at the moment, nor, above all, to the needs that at the present time pose the need for information also in the field of tourism management and also, obviously, for the sector.

Indeed, that is what leads me to rethink the issue of the observatory, in order to arrive at a structure that we can effectively call in such a way, as the Basque Tourist Observatory.

It is obvious that the approach cannot be as ambitious as that of the CIC Tourgune, because the CIC Tourgune had fifteen people working only for the development of this Basque Tourist Observatory, and obviously I do not count on those fifteen people, but it did not seem to me an option that we would conform to what there was, that we would conform to that Basque Tourist Observatory that does not develop all the potentialities that in the field of search, creation and production of data for tourist management are necessary today. And that is what really leads me to rethink not only this one, but also that of trade, starting from the creation of the statistical body to create, in fact, an observatory that, as I say, deserves such a name.

That's my point. Therefore, answering your question, although, I tell you, I cannot maintain an observatory that no longer exists (because that original observatory of CIC Tourgune does not exist), obviously the department's claim is to maintain a market intelligence in the structure of an observatory – which is much more than doing segmented or dispersed studies – to create an observatory structure to feed a source of data that allows the department and the different sectors to have information about the environment in which we move.

Thank you very much.

Thank you, Madam President.

Mrs. López de Ocariz, what you call cod is what you come to ask me to keep. Because when I've stopped inertia, because I want to change it, because I'm going to change it, because I'm actually changing it, it's when you've asked here two questions about the supposed paralysis of the observatory. Simply because I have not been carried away by inertia, because I have looked and seen that it was indeed necessary to change things.

I have already told you, I cannot, unfortunately, exercise the same ambition that CIC Tourgune had in 2010 when it proposed it (and that it actually opened in 2011, indeed, but in CIC Tourgune, I insist; check the data), because, as I say, I do not count even fifteen extra workers for that observatory, nor with that budget. But that does not mean that one should not be ambitious and that when it comes to having an observatory, he tries to do, with what he has, everything he can to make sure that we actually have something that he can actually be called an observatory.

And I do have an approach. In fact, in the specific case of web pages we have already been working since January, in the change of that web page. Don't worry, it'll change. It'll change that... Nor do you know that the page of the observatory, which you said is so useful but should not have been used, because you do not have a photocopy of it, that the page of Tecnalia, with the data – already told you before – of the INE, the Eustat, the AENA and the Ports of the State, was opened last year, because it was neither accessible, neither for users nor for you if you wanted to check that page.

I told him that I do have an approach. I have already told you before that it is not the department's intention or my own to dispense with market intelligence at all, but, at the same time, we cannot settle for what is there. This work needs to be reorganized into something that can actually be called an observatory. For this – I said it the other day and I repeat it now – the first essential step is the creation of the statistical body of the department, which we do not have. The decree is made, the various reports are passed, and we have only one, which is from the Basque Bureau of Statistics.

The second step is to diagnose the situation, what are the possibilities of information, what are the relevant data sources, how to prioritize resources, minimize costs, and not duplicate actions, and ultimately set precise and consistent objectives of study and information.

And thirdly integrate as much as possible the different areas of the department.

Both the optimisation of resources and the non-compartmentalization of information, particularly that derived from our digital footprint, and even more so, in the areas of tourism, trade and consumption, in my opinion, impose the necessary transversality also in the approach of that department's observatory, regardless of the scope of action that each of the directorates may have. Transversality in addressing this work away from schematic, segmented and old visions, very old, Mrs López de Ocariz.

As was reflected in the original CIC Tourgune observatory project, in addressing information in this century it is necessary to apply competitive intelligence, open innovation and collective intelligence, and that is what I intend to develop around not a project, but a reality of the department's observatory that effectively meets the objectives not only of producing relevant information, but also of disseminating and reaching the sector, so that the sector can use it in defining its strategies. That's what I don't think is being done in a way that should be right now, and that's why I stopped when I was able to stop.

Because the same thing that happened to Ikusmer – and I told him two weeks ago – happened with this very partial maintenance of a very small part of CIC Tourgune's work by Tecnalia; that by 2017 the contract was awarded at the time I entered, and when I was able to act, when I stopped things so as not to let us get carried away by inertia and settle a new model of cash observatory, is when I was able to do it. And that's when you asked questions.
text:
Gracias, señora presidenta. Consejera, señorías.

Señora López de Ocariz, tiene usted últimamente una tendencia a enredarse en el nombre de las cosas y no hablar de las cosas mismas. Lo hizo hace dos semanas a propósito del Observatorio de la Distribución Comercial de Euskadi, y lo vuelve a hacer hoy a propósito del Observatorio Turístico de Euskadi.

Le diré. El Observatorio Turístico de Euskadi es una iniciativa de CIC Tourgune, que usted al menos menciona en la pregunta por escrito pero antes ha dejado de lado. El CIC Tourgune se crea en febrero de 2007, lo mismo que se crean otros como el Nanogune o el Biogune, con el objetivo de generar conocimiento en torno al turismo. Casi al mismo tiempo se crea Basquetour como Agencia Vasca de Turismo, para la promoción y, digamos, para analizar y fomentar la competitividad en los servicios turísticos de Euskadi, en lo que parecía una estrategia inteligente a medida que el turismo despegaba en Euskadi, con dos herramientas que permitían dar un soporte desde la gestión pública: dar un soporte por una parte en las acciones de promoción y de mejora de la competitividad del turismo en Euskadi, y por la otra en la generación de conocimiento en torno al turismo.

En 2010 el CIC Tourgune propone una colaboración con Basquetour para la creación de un observatorio turístico de Euskadi; una propuesta que yo conozco, una propuesta seria, una propuesta con contenido, una propuesta actual y bien apegada al terreno en el momento en el que se formula, y una propuesta también ambiciosa: se hablaba de inteligencia competitiva, se hablaba de innovación abierta y se hablaba de inteligencia colectiva. Y partía además del análisis de otros observatorios en España y en el mundo.

Y era una propuesta ambiciosa que planteaba tres áreas de mejora y que planteaba también una estructura ambiciosa. Las áreas de mejora eran una armonización de las fuentes (es sabido el pequeño guirigay que hay en torno a los indicadores en relación con el turismo); dos, una visualización y la posibilidad de permitir análisis dinámico de la información, y, tercero, la inclusión de fuentes de información digital, lo que después ha venido a denominarse big data . Y las áreas en que organizaba esa estructura del Observatorio Turístico de Euskadi al que usted hace referencia eran: un área de estadística, un área de turismo –la referida a esa información digital–, un área de estudios e investigaciones, y un área de documentación.

En 2012, fruto de ese planteamiento colaborativo de la creación del observatorio, se crea en Basquetour un puesto experto en investigación social, precisamente para que sirva de enlace con las necesidades que pueda plantear Basquetour con el desarrollo de investigación y el desarrollo tecnológico en torno a esa investigación que desarrolla el CIC Tourgune.

El CIC Tourgune no solamente plantea ese puesto experto de enlace, sino que empieza a desarrollar su sistema. Desarrolla un sistema regional de indicadores turísticos (el SRIT), desarrolla un monitor de precios hoteleros, desarrolla un monitor de webs de destino, e inicia el diseño de varias herramientas en torno a la creación de ese observatorio turístico de Euskadi. Que no es, como usted ha dicho, un observatorio turístico de Euskadi de Basquetour, sino un observatorio turístico de Euskadi que desarrolla CIC Tourgune en colaboración con Basquetour.

¿Pero qué pasa en 2015? Pues en 2015 hay una revisión de los CIC (de los centros de investigación cooperativa), y uno de los que se cierra es este, CIC Tourgune. Por lo tanto, si se cierra CIC Tourgune y el Observatorio Turístico de Euskadi está en CIC Tourgune, el Observatorio Turístico de Euskadi al que usted hace referencia en su interpelación ya no está. Lo que queda después es, por decirlo así, un pálido reflejo del proyecto original de Observatorio Turístico de Euskadi que plantea el CIC Tourgune.

¿Qué es lo que queda del CIC Tourgune? Queda una parte de su… Fíjese que este era el desarrollo completo del observatorio.

¿Sabe lo que queda? Queda una parte, esta pequeña parte, que es la carga automática de información de fuentes estadísticas. Es una pequeña parte no solamente porque solamente hace referencia a algunos indicadores, sino también porque no incluye las fuentes de origen datos que incluía el SRIT en origen.

Pero, ante el interés del departamento por mantener en ese momento –una vez que CIC Tourgune se cierra–, por mantener una base de datos que se venía construyendo por parte de CIC Tourgune, una base de datos en torno a una serie de indicadores, aunque fuera más limitada que el modelo original, lo que se hace es transportar la herramienta construida por CIC Tourgune y contratar el mantenimiento de la información respecto de esa herramienta.

Y eso es lo que, con el cierre en 2015 de CIC Tourgune, ha hecho, efectivamente, Tecnalia en 2016 y en 2017. Y recibe el nombre de Observatorio Turístico de Euskadi, pero obviamente no tiene nada que ver este Observatorio Turístico de Euskadi. Es más, hay otro Observatorio Turístico de Euskadi, que es al que hace referencia una de las páginas que usted ha enseñado aquí.

La persona experta responsable de investigación que servía de enlace con CIC Tourgune en Basquetour también organiza dentro de Basquetour un área que se denomina Observatorio Turístico de Euskadi. Las dos cosas son cosas distintas, pero las dos reciben el mismo nombre, y ninguna de las dos cosas es en realidad el proyecto ambicioso, y, desde mi punto de vista, inteligente y bien planteado de origen, del CIC Tourgune en el año 2010.

Eso es lo que tenemos, y eso es lo que queda. En la difusión queda, además, la que hacemos desde el departamento puntualmente cada vez que damos información de los datos estadísticos, pero la recopilación, esa que decía usted tan interesante, por el mantenimiento de ese observatorio, en realidad era una pequeña parte que solo incluía la información del Eustat, del INE, de AENA y de Puertos del Estado.

Por supuesto que el departamento y yo mismo apostamos por mantener la inteligencia del mercado. Es absolutamente necesario, en el entorno de hoy –no solamente en turismo, pero desde luego en turismo también–, mantener información del entorno, porque, de lo contrario, la gestión pública se convierte simplemente en una especie de dar palos de ciego sin saber en qué entorno se mueve uno.

La inteligencia de mercado se mantiene. Mantenemos las operaciones estadísticas oficiales (le dije el otro día que eso era lo que justificaba la creación del órgano estadístico del departamento); Ibiltur, Familitur, Frontur, esas operaciones se mantienen, y además incluimos otros muchos estudios.

Pero el observatorio como tal, que no tiene que ver lo que llamamos hoy observatorio con el concepto original del Observatorio Turístico de Euskadi, en realidad no responde ni a las demandas que se le pueden hacer en el momento, ni sobre todo a las necesidades que en el momento actual plantea la necesidad de información también en el ámbito de la gestión turística y también, obviamente, para el sector.

Efectivamente, eso es lo que me lleva a replantear la cuestión del observatorio, para llegar a una estructura a la que efectivamente podamos llamar de tal manera, como Observatorio Turístico de Euskadi.

Es obvio que el planteamiento no puede ser tan ambicioso como el del CIC Tourgune, porque el CIC Tourgune tenía quince personas trabajando solo para el desarrollo de este Observatorio Turístico de Euskadi, y obviamente yo no cuento con esas quince personas, pero no me parecía opción que nos conformáramos con lo que había, que nos conformáramos con ese Observatorio Turístico de Euskadi que no desarrolla todas las potencialidades que en el ámbito de la búsqueda, de la creación y de la producción de datos para la gestión turística se hacen necesarias hoy en día. Y eso es lo que efectivamente me lleva a replantear no solamente este, sino también el de comercio, partiendo de la creación del órgano estadístico para crear, efectivamente, un observatorio que, como le digo, merezca tal nombre.

Ese es mi planteamiento. Por lo tanto, respondiendo a su pregunta, aunque, ya le digo, no puedo mantener un observatorio que ya no existe (porque ese observatorio original de CIC Tourgune no existe), obviamente la pretensión del departamento es mantener una inteligencia de mercado en la estructura de un observatorio –que es mucho más que hacer estudios segmentados o dispersos–, crear una estructura de observatorio para alimentar una fuente de datos que permita al departamento y a los distintos sectores tener información sobre el entorno en el que nos movemos.

Muchas gracias.

Gracias, señora presidenta.

Señora López de Ocariz, lo que usted llama chapuza es lo que viene a pedirme que mantenga. Porque cuando yo he parado la inercia, porque quiero cambiarlo, porque voy a cambiarlo, porque lo estoy cambiando de hecho, es cuando usted ha planteado aquí dos preguntas sobre la supuesta paralización del observatorio. Sencillamente porque yo no me he dejado llevar por la inercia, porque he mirado y he visto que efectivamente había que cambiar las cosas.

Ya le he dicho, no puedo, lamentablemente, ejercer la misma ambición que tenía el CIC Tourgune en 2010 cuando lo planteó (y que efectivamente se abrió en 2011, efectivamente, pero en CIC Tourgune, insisto; revise los datos), porque, como le digo, no cuento ni con quince trabajadores extra para ese observatorio, ni con ese presupuesto. Pero eso no significa que uno no deba ser ambicioso y que cuando se plantea tener un observatorio trate de hacer, con lo que tiene, todo lo que pueda para que efectivamente tengamos algo que pueda recibir efectivamente el nombre de observatorio.

Y efectivamente tengo un planteamiento. De hecho, en el caso concreto de las páginas web ya llevamos trabajando desde enero, en el cambio de esa página web. No se preocupe, que cambiará. Cambiará esa… Tampoco sabe usted que la página del observatorio, esa que decía usted que es tan útil pero que no debe de haber usado, porque no tiene fotocopia de ella, que la página de Tecnalia, con los datos –ya le decía antes– del INE, del Eustat, de AENA y de Puertos del Estado, se abrió el año pasado, porque tampoco estaba accesible, ni para los usuarios ni para usted si quería comprobar esa página.

Le decía que efectivamente tengo un planteamiento. Ya le he dicho antes que no es intención del departamento ni mía propia prescindir de la inteligencia de mercado, en absoluto, pero, al mismo tiempo, no podemos conformarnos con lo que hay. Es necesario reorganizar esta labor en algo que efectivamente pueda llamarse observatorio. Para ello –se lo dije el otro día y se lo repito ahora–, el primer paso imprescindible es la creación del órgano estadístico del departamento, que no tenemos. El decreto está hecho, están pasados los distintos informes, y nos queda solamente uno, que es de la Oficina Vasca de Estadística.

El segundo paso es diagnosticar la situación, cuáles son las posibilidades de información, cuáles son las fuentes de datos pertinentes, cómo priorizar recursos, minimizar costes, y no duplicar acciones, y, en definitiva, establecer objetivos precisos y coherentes de estudio e información.

Y en tercer lugar integrar en lo posible las distintas áreas del departamento.

Tanto la optimización de recursos como la característica no compartimentalización de la información, particularmente la que procede de nuestra huella digital, y más aún, si cabe, en los ámbitos de turismo, de comercio y de consumo, imponen, a mi juicio, la necesaria transversalidad también en el planteamiento de ese observatorio del departamento, independientemente del margen de acción que pueda tener cada una de las direcciones. Transversalidad al abordar esta labor lejos de visiones esquemáticas, segmentadas y viejas, muy viejas, señora López de Ocariz.

Como recogía el proyecto original de observatorio del CIC Tourgune, al abordar la información en este siglo es preciso aplicar inteligencia competitiva, innovación abierta e inteligencia colectiva, y eso es lo que yo pretendo desarrollar en torno no a un proyecto, sino a una realidad de observatorio del departamento que efectivamente cumpla con los objetivos no solamente de producción de la información pertinente, sino también de difusión y de que esa información llegue al sector, para que el sector pueda utilizarla en la definición de sus estrategias. Eso es lo que a mi juicio no se cumple de manera todo lo adecuada que debería ser en el momento actual, y esa es la razón por la que yo he parado cuando he podido parar.

Porque lo mismo que me ocurrió con Ikusmer –y se lo conté hace dos semanas– pasaba con este mantenimiento muy parcial de una parte muy pequeña del trabajo de CIC Tourgune por parte de Tecnalia; que para el año 2017 el contrato estaba adjudicado en el momento en el que yo entré, y cuando yo he podido actuar, cuando he parado cosas para no dejarnos llevar por la inercia y asentar un nuevo modelo de efectivo observatorio, es cuando he podido hacerlo. Y es el momento en el que usted ha hecho preguntas.

text_en:
Yes, ma'am, from the seat, if you please.

I simply wish to highlight the agreement reached and the Government's commitment to further progress in this area, although it is clear that the foundations are laid.

And, Mrs Ubera, if you want and want these rules to reach the last person of all public administrations, you have the opportunity to approve or support the Basque public employment law, which we have collected there. It'll be in your hands.

And, just like that, I want to congratulate you on the deal.

Thank you.
text:
Bai, legebiltzarburu andrea, eserlekutik, zure baimenarekin.

Yo, sin más, quiero resaltar el acuerdo alcanzado y resaltar el compromiso del Gobierno en seguir avanzando en esta materia, aunque está claro que los cimientos están puestos.

Y, señora Ubera, si usted quiere y desea que estas normas lleguen hasta la última persona de todas las administraciones públicas, tiene la oportunidad de aprobar o de apoyar la ley de empleo público vasca, que ahí lo tenemos recogido. Estará en sus manos.

Y, sin más, quiero felicitarme por el acuerdo.

Eskerrik asko.

text_en:
Good morning, everyone.

Mr. President, first of all, we must say that we asked for your special appearance because it seems very important to us for this matter, and we understand that the Poptular party has finally renounced this demand, because they are the principal cause of it, but on the other hand we can't understand why the Euquid Party rejected it.

In the end, you yourself said that, you yourself said, in our days, there are more and more decisions that have been or are being attacked by the Spanish Government. There are, for instance, the housing and fracing laws, the system of educational scholarships, the question of 35-hour work, the business of the public calling of the Border, the education system, or Osacment, etc., etc., etc., etc., etc., etc.

Finally, what we're looking at is that the autonomical construction itself is digging through, because they're emptying in hand from Madrid, and we're really worried about the situation. Finally, we think that our institutions and our institutions are the decisions that are being attacked from the government of Madrid.

In front of this, on behalf of EH Collect, we believe that we should all agree to a strategy of defending these decisions and our institutions. We think that we should agree with each other.

We don't know if there's any will for that or not from the President and I'm telling you about it, we don't feel like it. And on this side it seems to us that it may be difficult to say that we want a greater degree of independence, when we are unable to defend what we have.

And we've just heard that in the press where we read it, you've just refused to join the ELA union.

We read yesterday in press that the lehendakari refused to meet with ELA, with an attitude that in our opinion cannot be that of a lehendakari. A lehendakari has to be willing to sit down and listen to what he likes to hear and what he doesn't like to hear too. And in our case, what we are asking, what we are also asking the lehendakari is, without the need for any arrogance or arrogance or pride, but if it would not be necessary a little more firmness, of that firmness displayed with regard to, for example, the majority union of the Basque Autonomous Community, a little bit of that firmness with regard to which it does not allow us to materialise the decisions we make in our own institutions and with which day by day our competitive framework is emptying, thus preventing us from fully developing the social and economic policies that we would like for the good of our citizens.

Thank you.

Thank you.

Lehendakari jauna, to be more concrete and more direct perhaps, we would like to know – because in the self-government presentation we are with the Basque Nationalist Party, among other parties, and we are willing to carry that work and that dynamic of collaboration, of course – but we would like to know what is the pillar of this government's strategy to defend our institutions and its own decisions, whether there is going to be a strategy to define and agree with other political parties, with other political formations like ours, which would be willing to do it, or if its only strategy is to wait and sit and see if Spanish citizens decide to change government, and that would be our only strategy to defend our own institutions. Or if, on the contrary, we and we are going to do something for our own sake, to defend our own and even to extend our margins of decision to full sovereignty.
text:
Egun on guztioi.

Lehendakari jauna, lehenengo eta behin esan behar dugu guk zure agerraldi berezia eskatu genuela gai honetarako ikaragarrizko garrantzia duela iruditzen zaigulako, eta ulertzen dugu k uko egin izana eskaera horri, azkenean, beraiek direlako egoera horren errudun nagusiak, baina beste alde batetik ez dugu ulertzen zergatik k uko egin zion agerraldi-eskaera horri.

Azkenean, zuek esan duzue –zuk zeuk ere esan duzu– azkenaldian euskal instituzioek hartzen dituzten gero eta erabaki gehiago ari direla betatuak izaten edo ari direla erasotuak izaten Espainiako Gobernuaren partetik. Badira, adibidez, etxebizitza eta fracking legeak, bada hezkuntzako beken sistemaren kasua, 35 orduko lanaldiaren kontua, Ertzaintzaren lan-deialdi publikoaren kontua, hezkuntza-sistema edo Osakidetza, eta abar eta abar.

Azkenean, ikusten ari garena da eraikin autonomikoa bera zulatzen ari direla, eskumenez hustutzen ari direlako Madriletik, eta erabat kezkatzen gaitu egoera horrek. Azkenean, pentsatzen dugu gure instituzioak eta gure instituzioek hartzen dituzten erabakiak direla erasotuak izaten ari direnak Madrilgo Gobernuaren partetik.

Horren aurrean, gure partetik, ren partetik, uste dugu guztion artean adostu beharko genukeela erabaki horiek eta gure instituzioak defendatzeko estrategia bat. Gure ustez, hori adostu beharko genuke guztion artean.

Ez dakigu horretarako borondaterik dagoen ala ez lehendakariaren partetik eta Jaurlaritzaren partetik, iruditzen zaigu ezetz. Eta alde horretatik iruditzen zaigu zaila izan daitekeela esatea burujabetza maila handiagoa nahi dugula, estatus politiko berri bat nahi dugula, daukaguna defendatzeko gai ez garenean.

Eta entzun dugu berriki –atzo bertan irakurri genuen prentsan– ELArekin, ELA sindikatuarekin biltzeari uko egin diozula.

Leímos ayer en prensa que el lehendakari se negaba a reunirse con ELA, con una actitud que en nuestra opinión no puede ser la de un lehendakari. Un lehendakari tiene que estar dispuesto a sentarse y a escuchar aquello que le gusta oír y aquello que no le gusta oír también. Y en nuestro caso, lo que pedimos, lo que preguntamos también al lehendakari es, sin necesidad de ninguna prepotencia ni ninguna arrogancia, ni ninguna soberbia, pero si no sería necesario un poquito más de firmeza, de esa firmeza exhibida con respecto, por ejemplo, al sindicato mayoritario de la Comunidad Autónoma vasca, un poquito de esa firmeza con respecto a quien no permite materializar las decisiones que tomamos en nuestras propias instituciones y con respecto a quien día a día está vaciando nuestro marco competencial, impidiendo así que podamos desarrollar en su plenitud las políticas sociales y económicas que querríamos para el bien de nuestros ciudadanos y ciudadanas.

Eskerrik asko.

Eskerrik asko.

Lehendakari jauna, para ser más concretos y más directos quizás, quisiéramos saber –porque en la ponencia de autogobierno estamos con el Partido Nacionalista Vasco, entre otros partidos, y estamos dispuestos a llevar ese trabajo y esa dinámica de colaboración, por supuesto–, pero quisiéramos saber cuál es el pilar de la estrategia de este Gobierno para defender nuestras instituciones y sus propias decisiones, si va a haber una estrategia a definir y acordar con otros partidos políticos, con otras formaciones políticas como la nuestra, que estaría dispuesta a hacerlo, o si su única estrategia es esperar, esperar sentados a ver si los ciudadanos y las ciudadanas españolas deciden cambiar de gobierno, y esa sería nuestra única estrategia para defender nuestras propias instituciones. O si, por el contrario, nosotros y nosotras vamos a hacer algo por lo nuestro, para defender lo nuestro e incluso para ampliar nuestros márgenes de decisión hasta una soberanía plena.

text_en:
Thank you, Madam President.

True, we have been discussing this matter, in one way or another, with one intensity or another, for a long time. Did Mr. Pastor say forty years? Well, it probably is. Probably so, because, in parallel to the economic, social and political development experienced by Euskadi over these forty years, allowed and driven by the rules of self-government of which we are democratically endowed, fundamentally the Statute of Autonomy, on a regular basis the nationalist discourse accompanied it, that economic and social development without parallel of course in the history of Euskadi, but also without parallel in relation to the rest of the autonomous communities of Spain, the Basque Nationalist Party, or the whole of the nationalists, were jealous of their interventions with a claim or a permanent complaint, I believe that the fruit of the essence of nationalism, which, if it ceases to claim, loses part of its nature and essence. So far we can all understand it from an intellectual point of view.

In fact, Mr Ardanza tried it, look, Mr Ibarretxe tried it, and now it seems, although few believe it, that Mr Urkullu will try it too.

But what is true is that over the last four years, with renewed intensity, we have participated in a paper created to affect us to reflect on the development of the Statute of Autonomy (that was the origin of that paper, to reflect on the development of the Statute of Autonomy) and to share a reflection, or the basis for its hypothetical updating, without a prioriism. Because we also agreed then that there could be a position, quite naive on the part of some, among which I included myself, under which it would be detected or agreed that there was no need for reform of the Statute of Autonomy. And then I'll talk about this.

But the conclusion, after four years, was that we already knew practically all of us were going to have, and that is that we did not bring anything especially new. Nothing especially new after four years.

We constitute that presentation, and it basically served to repeat what we already know we think about each other, to listen to each other. It is not bad to listen, but it is true that for practical purposes it does not contribute very much. Perhaps we know something new today, to amend myself: we know that the Basque Nationalist Party, by the mouth of its spokesman, is betting on a pact based on the right to decide, and that its governing partner seems to say something else, and I suspect that this can create some kind of discomfort in the relationship between the two parties, but we will see.

Over the last four years – and this is for those who did not have the luck, the fortune of participating in these debates, and there is no irony on my part in these words – we listen to jurists of recognized prestige; we listen to experts, not jurists, of recognized prestige, to others who had perhaps less recognized prestige; we listen to many supposedly independent people; we listen to politicians in active exercise; we listen to ex-politicians, ex-representatives, ex-governors; we even listen to people coming from other parts of Europe to tell us their experiences, and some, with some daring, to tell us what we had to do. This has happened over the past four years.

Also the political groups represented there had the opportunity to share, to talk to us, as he said before, to tell us what vision we have of the development of self-government and what we have (generically, but we did) opinion on the future of the development of our self-government, or the future, in any case, of the norms we possess.

All this energy, all this energy – you will value whether you use it or not, given where we are today – is what we have dedicated over the past four years. Energy dedicated to a topic that I have the feeling, and I think it can be a generally shared feeling, that it doesn't seem to upset Basque society too much. I do not have the feeling, we do not have the pulse, at least we, that this debate is causing a great deal of distress in the Basque population as a whole. But, well, we ourselves, four years dedicated to this, even though the problems are growing on the other hand, even though the great challenges we have to face are going on the other way.

And today, today, the re-edition of this paper is submitted to this House for consideration. Come on, second txanda.

We, I have to confess that after these four years in the paper, after the experience of decades, Mr Pastor, but after having deepened and updated the positions over these four years, we came to a conclusion that we put in writing, and that is that we did not believe that a reform of the Statute of Autonomy is necessary; in any case, that a reform of the Statute of Autonomy is not urgent. And we supported this position and argued for two fundamental reasons.

The first of them, which we believe we still have an unexplored and unexpressed capacity for self-government. That we believe that we have some tools of self-government that can still bear many fruits, just as they have so far, and that we can continue to express and take advantage of them. That we believe that there is a huge task to be addressed, such as modernizing and improving the administration and service we provide to the citizen. That we believe that there are great challenges that affect Euskadi, Spain, but the whole of Europe and the world (demographic challenges, challenges of how to keep the welfare state), that there are great challenges that do require all our energy and all our dedication, which are probably prior to opening these debates, these melons.

That we believe that there are institutional reforms in the Basque Country itself, that articulate our complex, varied institutional framework, that require modernisation as well as improvement, and that they are not minor debates and that they are not debates that are precisely to be closed in parliamentary debates of one morning, that require a deep reflection: the parliaments, our capitals, how we do to make the Administration more agile, more transparent as well, and more effective in the service it provides to the citizen.

This was one of the fundamental reasons why we believe that it is not necessary to reform the Statute of Autonomy now: that there is a previous job still to be done.

And the second of the reasons is because, in view of what we have heard from each other and of the demonstrations made both within the presentation and in the political demonstrations that we are doing, we believe that we would be in trouble, Mr Lehendakari. We believe that at this moment, with the threats and the great challenges that we have to address, with the uncertainties that we have as a society (but not the Basque one, I dare say that the West), with the great debates that we have to address and solve, I believe that, given the positions of both of us, now in Basquedi we would be in a mess of unpredictable consequences.

We believe that it is much more positive at this time to bet on collaboration, on interdependence, on seeking synergies with our neighbours (which unites us, rather than separating us), and to take advantage, I insist, of the potentiality of the Statute of Autonomy. And we believe that this debate can lead us to a dead end, or in any case it can lead us to a situation that we have already experienced in the past.

And, in any case – and hence our amendment, Mr Pastor – we need, we ask, politically implore you to translate once and for all, Mr Egibar, Mr lehendakari, to translate into us what bilaterality is, what cosoberania is, what is the new status. That is why we ask for an articulated text. That's why we're asking for a concretion.

Look, Mr. lehendakari, we know no, I'm going to tell you that we're intuition, because we don't think you're exactly a brainless person, quite the opposite (maybe we think you're a wrong person, but certainly not a brainless person), we feel that you look back at what's happening in Catalonia. We know that the Basque Nationalist Party looks with interest – I am going to use this euphemism – what happens in Catalonia. We take it that they take good note. But we want to say one thing to you too, Mr Lehendakari: you cannot make calculations about the unpredictable. You can't do calculations about the unpredictable, because it usually goes wrong. And it does not go wrong for the political parties or for the debate in this House, but it goes wrong for the very society to which we intend to serve.

Unforeseeable calculations have unpredictable developments, and they also have unpredictable outcomes. And we have to take good care of this. We must strive to generate stability, in our opinion, Mr Lehendakari; we must strive to seek the points of agreement and understanding between Basques fundamentally, but also in our relationship with the rest of the Spaniards, and that should be our goal, because the opposite is to play with fire.

But, if you still remain committed to developing a road map and to developing a political position that Mr Egibar sometimes expresses in one way, I think that with a lot of clarity, other times other leaders of the Basque Nationalist Party modulate it, other times Mr lehendakari tells us something else, sometimes use an euphemism, sometimes use another..., what we want to tell you is the following. It is legitimate to claim a reform of a rule, it is also legitimate to claim the reform of the Statute of Autonomy, but what must be said is what is meant to change and for what, because, if not, we will not be faced with a debate, we will be faced with a strategy of part, which is the strategy of the Basque Nationalist Party, to which we are all led.

A strategy that can be dilatory, or a strategy that can be to park this debate in a committee in Parliament so as not to have problems with my governing partner or not to reveal the true intentions.

That is why our amendment goes there: after so many decades of debate, after these last four years of reflection, whoever wants and who has a proposal for reform of a new status, or with the euphemism of it, that we present it so that we can discuss it. Let us present an articulated text on which the political parties represented in this House can express themselves. Because, if not, we'll be playing PNV strategy. We will not be provoking a debate, we will not be facilitating a debate to reform our statutory rule: we will be playing out your strategy, Mr Lehendakari.

And you have full legitimacy to have a strategy, you have full legitimacy to park debates, to hide them, to use euphemisms, but to what we also have the right others is to demand clarity once and for all. Because this identity debate, by which one day one thing is said here in this rostrum and another at the party headquarters, does not bring anything positive to Euskadi or the Basques.

Thank you very much.
text:
Gracias, señora presidenta.

Es verdad, llevamos debatiendo sobre este asunto, de una u otra manera, con una u otra intensidad, mucho tiempo. ¿Decía el señor Pastor cuarenta años? Bueno, probablemente sí. Probablemente sí, porque, en paralelo al desarrollo económico, social y político experimentado por Euskadi a lo largo de estos cuarenta años, permitido e impulsado por las normas de autogobierno de las que nos dotamos democráticamente, fundamentalmente el Estatuto de Autonomía, con carácter periódico el discurso nacionalista lo acompañaba, ese desarrollo económico y social sin parangón desde luego en la historia de Euskadi, pero también sin parangón en relación con el resto de las comunidades autónomas de España, el Partido Nacionalista Vasco, o el conjunto de los nacionalistas, jalonaban sus intervenciones con una reivindicación o una queja permanente, creo que fruto de la esencia propia del nacionalismo, que si deja de reivindicar, pues, pierde parte de su naturaleza y esencia. Hasta ahí todos lo podemos entender desde un punto de vista intelectual.
